page.title: 15 LOCAL HISTORY - cont'd.
page.content: SCHOOL - about 120-130pupils in Miss Walker's day - 4 teachers - long desks with inkwells in them. Teaching mostly from blackboard - some "enlightened" methods e.g Practical Maths - children would use a 'chain' to measure distnt from school to vicarage or the distance round a turnip plot. Magic lantern shows - for geography. Daily Inspection took place for genral cleanliness,clean shoes etc., Games played - shuttlecock, hoop - round steeel hoops were made by the local smithy, top and whip.. Summer holidays were flexible - taken to coincide with local hay harvest. Children stayed at school until 14yrs. Occasionally one or two won scholarship to Grammar school at Anthony Gell,Wirksworth.
